intro: Dryandra pseudoplumosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid climates of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
